Package userinterface

Class GenericSplitPane

java.lang.Object
userinterface.AbstractFrame
userinterface.Pane
userinterface.GenericSplitPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
HorizontalSplitPane, VerticalSplitPane
public abstract class GenericSplitPane
extends Pane
A class extending Pane to handle the splitting of LeafPane's when adding a new LeafPane to it by transforming it into a Pane with two LeafPane's as attributes

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    boolean dragging
    A boolean to denote whether the user is currently dragging a separator.
    protected int SEPARATOR_THICKNESS
    A constant of type int that denotes the thickness of the separator drawn between split windows.

  • Constructor Details

    • GenericSplitPane

      public GenericSplitPane​(int x, int y, int width, int height, LeafPane childPane, Pane parentPane) throws IllegalDimensionException
      Initialize this GenericSplitPane with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - : The x coordinate of this GenericSplitPane.
      y - : The y coordinate of this GenericSplitPane.
      width - : The width of this GenericSplitPane
      height - : The height of this GenericSplitPane
      childPane - : the LeafPane child of this GenericSplitPane
      parentPane - : the Pane parent of this GenericSplitPane
      Throws:
      IllegalDimensionException

  • Method Details

    • updateListeners

      protected void updateListeners()
      Accesses the domain-layer through an observer design pattern linking the children (LeafPane's) of this GenericSplitPane (UI-layer) to the right Document (Domain-layer). This results in children of this GenericSplitPane listening to changes in their respective Document.

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      render the contents of this GenericSplitPane.
      Specified by:
      render in class AbstractFrame
      Parameters:
      g - : The graphics to be rendered.

    • handleMouse

      public void handleMouse​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount, int button, int modifiersEx)
      Handle mouseEvents. Determine if this GenericSplitPane was pressed and do the right actions.
      Specified by:
      handleMouse in class Pane
      Parameters:
      id - : The type of mouse activity
      x - : The x coordinate of the mouse activity
      y - : The y coordinate of the mouse activity
      clickCount - : The number of clicks
      button - : The mouse button that was clicked
      modifiersEx - : The control keys that were held on the click

    • handleKey

      public void handleKey​(int id, int keyCode, char keyChar, int modifiersEx)
      Handle key presses. This method does the right action when a key is pressed.
      Specified by:
      handleKey in class Pane
      Parameters:
      id - : The KeyEvent (Associated with type of KeyEvent)
      keyCode - : The KeyEvent code (Determines the involved key)
      keyChar - : The character representation of the involved key
      modifiersEx - : Specifies other keys that were involved in the event

    • handleResize

      public void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      This method handles resizes of this GenericSplitPane. It makes sure the GenericSplitPane is adjusted in width when the window shrinks or grows. It does not change its height (e.g. look at Firefox).
      Specified by:
      handleResize in class Pane
      Parameters:
      newWindowWidth - : parameter containing the new window-width of this GenericSplitPane.
      newWindowHeight - : parameter containing the new window-height of this GenericSplitPane.
